## Description {#details}

A <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a> that writes to an std::string.

This is a simple adaptor class. This class does not encounter output errors. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-string-ostream">raw&#95;string&#95;ostream</a> operates without a buffer, delegating all memory management to the std::string. Thus the std::string is always up-to-date, may be used directly and there is no need to call <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream/#a520bdf57dfe3e73abb53d482893f0a27">flush()</a>.

Definition at line 661 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/raw-ostream-h">raw&#95;ostream.h</a>.

<SectionDefinition>

## Public Member Functions

### reserveExtraSpace() {#ab6404e90b84bda345a98539075706232}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::raw&#95;string&#95;ostream::reserveExtraSpace (uint64&#95;t ExtraSize)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
If possible, pre-allocate <code>ExtraSize</code> bytes for stream data.

i.e. it extends internal buffers to keep additional ExtraSize bytes. So that the stream could keep at least <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream/#a0f90ad570f71349466844ee9f2d06cd1">tell()</a> + ExtraSize bytes without re-allocations. <a href="#ab6404e90b84bda345a98539075706232">reserveExtraSpace()</a> does not change the size/data of the stream.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/raw-ostream-h/#l00681">681</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/raw-ostream-h">raw&#95;ostream.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### str() {#a6732e8d3ff8100a662ce73634840b990}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::string &amp; llvm::raw&#95;string&#95;ostream::str ()</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Returns the string&#39;s reference.

In most cases it is better to simply use the underlying std::string directly. TODO: Consider removing this API.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/raw-ostream-h/#l00679">679</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/raw-ostream-h">raw&#95;ostream.h</a>.
